intro: Thibaudia sarcantha, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a contrasting throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from spring to early summer.
